summary:
The Security Council:
- Decides to adopt the attached declaration on the global effort to combat terrorism.
 
Annex:
- Recalls resolutions 1269 (1999), 1368 (2001), and 1373 (2001).
- Declares international terrorism a serious threat to international peace and security and a challenge to all States and humanity.
- Condemns all acts of terrorism as criminal and unjustifiable, regardless of motivation.
- Stresses terrorism is contrary to the UN Charter's purposes and principles.
- Underlines terrorism endangers innocent lives, dignity, and security, and undermines global stability and prosperity.
- Affirms a sustained, comprehensive approach involving all Member States is essential to combat international terrorism.
- Stresses international efforts to broaden understanding among civilizations and address global issues will contribute to cooperation against terrorism.
- Welcomes States' commitment to fight terrorism, calls on States to become parties to relevant conventions and protocols, and encourages work in this area.
- Calls on States to implement resolution 1373 (2001) fully, assist each other, and deny support and safe haven to terrorists.
- Expresses determination to implement resolution 1373 (2001) in full cooperation with the UN membership, and welcomes progress made by the Counter-Terrorism Committee.
The Security Council:
 Recognizes States may need assistance implementing resolution 1373 (2001), invites them to inform the Counter-Terrorism Committee of areas where support is required. 
Invites the Counter-Terrorism Committee to explore assistance methods with States and international, regional, and subregional organizations, including: 
- promoting best practices and model laws 
- identifying existing technical, financial, and legislative assistance programs 
- promoting synergies between these programs. 
Calls on all States to intensify efforts to eliminate international terrorism.
